message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.HC, cs.IR 

This paper is about the design and evaluation of a trainable sentence planner for spoken dialogue systems. It involves natural language processing and machine learning techniques, which are commonly studied in the computer science subfield of computational linguistics (cs.CL). The paper also discusses the adaptation of the sentence planner to different domains and individuals, which relates to the subfields of artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and machine learning (cs.LG). The evaluation of the system's performance in providing restaurant information suggests a potential application in human-computer interaction (cs.HC). Finally, the paper explores the contribution of different feature sets, which is relevant to information retrieval (cs.IR).
